messages.messageBody:
> From: "Nancy from MI" <hammondcentral@...>
> Most of the time, when we're out, we get a positive response. With all
> the school shootings lately and all the arrests of kids who have been
> caught planning them, most people no longer think that you are crazy
> to take your kids out of school. We get a lot of approving smiles. Of
> course, we still get that dead stare when people don't quite know WHAT
> to say --- this always makes me laugh inside.


I think it's amusing that the most positive responses we get are from
younger people - late teens and early twenties - who invariably say
something like "You're so LUCKY" to my kids when they find out they're
homeschooling. That says it all :-)

I'll have to say that all the school shootings have certainly made our
relatives think we're more or less sane for not having our kids in school.
Ah, how things have changed in the last generation or so. Anyone remember
that in "Charlotte's Web", Avery (Fern's brother) takes his pop gun on the
school bus to school with him??

Blue Skies!
-Robin-
Mom to Mackenzie (8/28/96) "Mom, maybe when you die they'll put you in a
natural history museum"
and Asa (10/5/99) who likes to dive headfirst into the swimming pool!
